Person fatally struck by train in Newton
07 Nov 2019, 01:44 by Manoella Macedo



NEWTON, Mass. - A person was hit and killed by a Commuter Rail train in Newton on Wednesday night, transit police said.
According to officials, transit police received a call at around 8:15 p.m. for reports of a person struck by a train at the MBTA's West Newton Commuter Rail station.



Emergency crews found an adult man trespassed the right of way in the area of Lowell Avenue when he was hit by an inbound commuter rail train on the Framingham/Worcester line.



The man, whose age is unknown at this time, was pronounced dead on scene.



As a result of the incident, trains on the Framingham/Worcester line were significantly delayed while police canvassed the area. Many trains were canceled following the incident and riders were relocated to other trains.
Detectives and the Middlesex DA's office continue to investigate this incident.
